item.title: Croatians Elect Kolinda Grabar-Kitarovic as Their First Female President
item.description: In a tight runoff Ms. Grabar-Kitarovic beat President Ivo Josipovic winning 50.4 percent of the votes.
item.dc:creator: By JOANNA BERENDT and JOSEPH OROVIC
item.media:description: Kolinda Grabar-Kitarovic was the conservative challenger.

item.title: In Cold Political Terms, Far Right and French President Both Gain
item.description: After the terrorist attack in France, President Fran√ßois Hollande and the far-right leader Marine Le Pen have seen a boost in popularity, but no one expects the praise to last very long.
item.dc:creator: By STEVEN ERLANGER
item.media:description: Marine Le Pen of the right-wing National Front at a rally on Sunday in Beaucaire, France.

item.title: Paris March Against Terror Draws Huge Crowds and 40 World Leaders
item.description: More than a million people marched through Paris, watched by troops and police officers, to show solidarity after deadly terrorist attacks.
item.dc:creator: By LIZ ALDERMAN

item.title: Video Shows a Paris Gunman Declaring His Loyalty to the Islamic State
item.description: In a recording that appeared online on Sunday, two days after his death, Amedy Coulibaly appeared below the flag of the militant group.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By RUKMINI CALLIMACHI and ANDREW HIGGINS

item.title: For Jimmy Lai, Hong Kong‚Äôs Rebellious Tycoon, Next Battle May Be in Court
item.description: In the aftermath of democracy demonstrations in Hong Kong, Mr. Lai faces perhaps his greatest test, which could have bigger repercussions for the city.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL GOUGH
item.media:credit: Brent Lewin for The New York Times
item.media:description: Jimmy Lai, the majority owner and until recently chairman of Next Media Ltd., at his Hong Kong home. He was a near daily presence at protests last year.

item.title: Disliking Kim Jong-un, and ‚ÄòThe Interview‚Äô Even More
item.description: Several democracy activists with contacts in the North said the North Koreans they spoke with reacted to the film with derision and wounded feelings over the depiction of their country.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: World Briefing: Nigeria: Market Hit by Bombs Strapped to 2 Women
item.description: People were killed and 21 were wounded on Sunday when explosives attached to two young women, one of them about 15 years old, were detonated in a crowded market, according to a security official and medical workers.
item.dc:creator: By AGENCE FRANCE-PRESSE

item.title: World Briefing: Mozambique: Contaminated Beer Kills More Than 50
item.description: Contaminated traditional beer has killed 56 people in Mozambique, health officials said Sunday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Peru: Bus Plunges Into Ravine, Killing at Least 23
item.description: A bus carrying more passengers than was permitted fell off the road into a ravine in a remote area of the Andes, killing at least 23 people and injuring 44 others, the Peruvian authorities said Sunday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Lebanon: Islamic State Group Suspected in Explosion
item.description: A double suicide attack that killed eight people at a cafe in Tripoli was carried out by the Islamic State group, the interior minister said Sunday.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Egyptian Authorities Release One of Detained Morsi Advisers
item.description: Khaled al-Qazzaz, who was the foreign relations secretary and a leader of the Muslim Brotherhood, had been held without charges for 558 days.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: Terror Attacks in Paris: The Victims
item.description: A look at the lives of those who died in the attacks at Charlie Hebdo and elsewhere in Paris.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: Kerry Lays Groundwork for Obama‚Äôs Visit to India
item.description: Secretary of State John Kerry was in India on Sunday to set the stage for a visit by President Obama this month.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry, left, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi at an investment conference in Mr. Modi‚Äôs home state, Gujarat. President Obama will visit India later in January.

item.title: Amid Heavy Security, 40 World Leaders Join Huge Crowds for Unity March in Paris
item.description: Forty world leaders and hundreds of thousands of people came together at the rally, watched by hundreds of troops and police officers, after a series of terrorist attacks in the city.
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY and MA√èA de la BAUME

item.title: Anita Ekberg, International Screen Beauty, Dies at 83
item.description: The Swedish actress, best known for her role in ‚ÄúLa Dolce Vita,‚Äù was frequently quoted as saying that it was Federico Fellini, the director, who owed his success to her, and not the other way around.
item.dc:creator: By ANITA GATES
item.media:description: Anita Ekberg in ‚ÄúLa Dolce Vita,‚Äù released in 1960.

item.title: Anita Ekberg, International Screen Beauty and Fellini Star, Dies at 83
item.description: The Swedish actress, best known for her role in ‚ÄúLa Dolce Vita,‚Äù was frequently quoted as saying that it was Federico Fellini, the director, who owed his success to her, not the other way around.
item.dc:creator: By ANITA GATES
item.media:description: Anita Ekberg in ‚ÄúLa Dolce Vita,‚Äù released in 1960.

item.title: Scores Killed After Bus Collides With Oil Tanker in Pakistan
item.description: Rescue workers said the bus, operating in Sindh Province, was carrying 62 passengers inside and 10 on the roof.
item.dc:creator: By ZIA ur-REHMAN

item.title: In New Era of Terrorism, Voice From Yemen Echoes
item.description: Anwar al-Awlaki, an American who joined Al Qaeda but was killed by a C.I.A. drone strike in 2011, has remained a leading influence on jihadists, and there is evidence that Yemen‚Äôs Al Qaeda branch, and Mr. Awlaki, had a role in preparations for the deadly assault in Paris.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
item.dc:creator: By SCOTT SHANE
item.media:description: The radical cleric Anwar al-Awlaki, shown in a video lecture, has proved to be a sinister and durable inspiration after his death in a C.I.A. drone strike in September 2011.

item.title: Huge Crowds and Heavy Security Expected for Antiterror Rally in Paris
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of people, along with a large number of security officers, were expected in a show of unity after a series of attacks in the city.
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: French Police Say Suspect in Attack Evolved From Petty Criminal to Terrorist
item.description: Amedy Coulibaly, who had a long criminal record, presented himself as a model employee and transformed, in plain sight, into a hardened jihadist.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW HIGGINS
item.media:credit: Uncredited/Prefecture de Police Paris, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Amedy Coulibaly, left, and Hayat Boumeddiene.
